contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox football club | clubname = Kilwinning Rangers| fullname = Kilwinning Rangers Football Club | nickname = The Buffs | founded = 1899 | ground = Abbey Park,<br />Dovecot Lane<br />[[Kilwinning]] | capacity = 2,500 | chairman = {{flagicon|SCO}} Danny Watt | manager = {{flagicon|SCO}} George Grierson | league = [[Scottish Junior Football Ayrshire Division One|Stagecoach Super League - First Division]]| 2012/13 ( 1st Postion Ayrshire District League and now into Super League 1st for 2013/14 shirtsupplier= | shirtsponsors =| pattern_la1=_white_hoops|pattern_b1=_whitehoops|pattern_ra1=_white_hoops| leftarm1=0000FF|body1=0000FF|rightarm1=0000FF|shorts1=FFFFFF|socks1=FFFFFF| pattern_la2=|pattern_b2=_thinwhitesides|pattern_ra2=| leftarm2=FF0000|body2=FF0000|rightarm2=FF0000|shorts2=000000|socks2=000000| }} '''Kilwinning Rangers''' are a Scottish [[football (soccer)|football]] club from [[Kilwinning]], [[Ayrshire]]. Formed in 1899 they have had periods of success throughout their history although the biggest Highlight was winning '''Six Trophies''' during the 1998/99 Season Kilwinning then became the first Ayrshire side to win the West Super League in the season 2003-04 but then followed a period struggle once again. Some up and down seasons followed after winning the Super League but finally Signs of recovery are there for all to see and that was confirmed this season when Kilwinning Rangers won the Ayrshire District League. They play their home games at Abbey Park and compete in the Western Region Junior League. They play in blue and white hoops. '''Rivals''' Irvine Meadow over the years have always been the main rivals to Kilwinning Rangers. == Honours == ===Scottish Junior Cup=== * Winners: 1908–09, 1998–99 * Runners-up: 1909–10, 1921–22 ===West Superleague Premier Division=== * Winners: 2003–04 Ayrshire District League '''Winners 2012/13''' ===Other Honours=== * West of Scotland Cup: 1993–94, 1998–99 * Ayrshire First Division winners: 1920–21, 1922–23, 1927–28, 1930–31, 1931–32, 1965–66, 1998–99, 1999–00, 2000–01 * Ayrshire Second Division winners: 1980–81, 1988–89, 1990–91 * Ayrshire Cup: 1904–05, 1908–09, 1934–35, 1976–77, 1985–86, 1994–95, 1997–98, 1998–99, 1999–00, 2001–02 * Ayrshire League Cup: 1929–30, 1998–99 * Ayrshire District Cup: 1905–06, 1920–21, 1931–32, 1958–59, 1995–96, 1998–99, 2000–01, 2001–02 * North Ayrshire Cup: 1995–96, 1997–98, 1999–00, 2000–01 * Western Intermediate League Cup: 1929–30 * Irvine & District League: 1907–08, 1908–09, 1913–14 Top Prospect : Ben Lewis ==External links== * [http://www.kilwinningrangersfc.co.uk Official website] {{SJFA Ayrshire District League}} [[Category:Football clubs in Scotland]] [[Category:Sport in North Ayrshire]] [[Category:Association football clubs established in 1899]] [[Category:Scottish Junior Football Association clubs]] [[Category:Kilwinning Rangers F.C.| ]] [[Category:Kilwinning]] [[Category:1899 establishments in Scotland]] {{Scotland-footyclub-stub}}
